context_bundle.summary: Systemd service management for Linux systems: create .service units in /etc/systemd/system/, define [Unit], [Service], [Install] sections. Commands: systemctl start/stop/restart/enable/disable/status. Service types: simple, forking, oneshot, notify. Use timers for scheduling (systemd.timer). Manage dependencies with Requires/After/Before.

onboarding.quick_start: Systemd service creation: create /etc/systemd/system/myapp.service with [Unit] Description, [Service] ExecStart/User/WorkingDirectory/Restart, [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target. Commands: systemctl daemon-reload, systemctl enable myapp, systemctl start myapp, systemctl status myapp. For scheduling: create myapp.timer with OnCalendar=daily or OnBootSec=5min. Type=simple (default), Type=forking (daemonizes), Type=oneshot (single run).
